So gateway creation part of tui seems complete and not buggy atm. Would be great if someone will try to create different gateways with it

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Trying to repair unit tests for dice on latest FSM. But facing very strange behaviour atm.
I'm placing 10 bets in test and every time getting win result (most of the time it's refund)
1 strange thing is that I'm getting refund for more than in half of bets and never getting loss
2 strange thing is that  on refund sometimes `"won": 0.0998`, sometimes  `"won": 0.0999`
3 strange thing that on bet of 1 coin sometimes I'm getting : ` {"status": "win", "won": 0.00029998, "result": "success"}` what is totally confusing

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I'm broadcasting a bet, mining a block with it, then broadcasting dicefinish, mining a block with it, then calling dicestatus and only after it broadcasting next bet

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL very interesting. My suggestion is to break down things into "this is probably a bug in the test" versus "this is probably a change in behavior"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL why is the response `{"status": "win", "won": 0.00029998, "result": "success"} ` totally confusing? I have been out of the loop a bit üòÉ

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Test doing nothing special in this place, just `dicebet ["LUCKY", "9f0df07668e9050bf80b11394fd012f50c694630c9a27ca211953127b0926336", "1", "2"]`

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: It's totally confusing because I'm betting 1 coin, not even sure in which cases I can get back 0.00029998

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i think i wrote these tests originally, but a lot has been changing

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the tests may be making assumptions that are no longer true

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: or, the tests may have been fragile. They depended too much on each other, and now one change makes all the tests after that fail

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: try to find the very first thing that fails, concentrate on that. All other failures could be caused by the first "bad test" or "no longer correct" assumption

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: "never getting a loss" could maybe be related to lack of entropy

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Thing above is what's fails @dukeleto 
Before I've placed 10 bets, counted wins and loses to check if balanace changing correct and it's worked because I've received "loss" or "win" of bet amount * odds+1

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @dukeleto Is it ok to separate tests as a classes to files like a dice.py and run in cryptoconditions.py `run_tests` as a dice.run_dice_tests() or better to have separate run_tests in each file and run it like a `PYTHON_DEBUG=1  qa/pull-tester/rpc-tests.sh dice --tracerpc` ?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL does only the dice tests need 2 nodes, or will other CC's benefit from having 2 nodes?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL i am leaning towards having cryptoconditions_dice.py, cryptoconditions_oracle.py, one test file per contract type

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL do the nodes need different config/CLI arguments, or can they be the same config?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: we can keep cryptoconditions.py, the original test file. New tests for each contract type, go in a dedicated file for each. That keeps things simple

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @dukeleto at the moment seems only dice need additional nodes - in future gateways CC tests will need multiply nodes as well

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Seems additional node will make faucet tests easier as well

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I think same config is ok

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL ok, it sounds like all tests can inherit a setup with 2 nodes, and then each CC test can decide how to use each node

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's a more realistic test environment as well, some errors/bugs cannot be found by doing everything on the same node

Author: TonyL#3577
dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL Yes and yes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL tho it hasn't been tested to start 2 nodes in regest, there could be gremlins

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL in fact, i believe there are some gremlins, which is why I didn't go further at the time

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: do you see how the ports are hard-coded at https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/jl777/qa/rpc-tests/cryptoconditions.py#L46 ?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: instead of using the python lib 2 start 2 nodes for you, i would manually start the 2 nodes with your own `setup_network` for now

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the python test library doesn't fully understand how to spin up N nodes and know the correct port numbers for them

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this is related to AC's having a specific port combination, based on the AC name

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so REGTEST AC always has the same port, which is why that hack works in our test suite, to know the rpcport ahead of time. The zcash test infra we inherited, the test suite tells the node which ports to use.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL we could have REGTEST and REGTEST2 AC's, and then you could put in the fixed ports that REGTEST2 would have

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL so `extra_args`, which is currently of length 1, would become an array of length 2, the second entry would be REGTEST2 values, with `self.num_nodes=2`, that might work

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @dukeleto Hmm, thanks - understood the idea in general but have to try to be sure I understood it üòÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL trying is the best way to learn. give it a try and i can help you if you get stuck and/or review the PR

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: my time is limited right now, i won't be able to work on it myself, but I can advise you

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Sure, thanks for all your help @dukeleto üôå

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL and to explain, if it's not clear, `extra_args` is an array of arrays, and each array is the extra arguments added to that nodes startup `komodod`, in addition to whichever are added by default. Currently it's only specifying the args for one node, and we want to update that and specify the extra_args for 2 nodes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: make the -ac_name of the new node REGTEST2, and then specify the p2p+rpc ports of REGTEST2, leave everything else the same

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that has a reasonable chance of working üòÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's time somebody else understood these internals üòâ

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Aren't the nodes will be on different chains in such case?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: hmm, maybe that was the gremlins üòÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: in that case, we need to over-ride rpc/p2p port, correctly, and maybe that is where I stopped

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this is confusing stuff, i went deep into making the ZEC test suite work on KMD

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ZEC has no asset chains

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so KMD asset chains are a complexity the original code was never designed for

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i just did the smallest amount of work to "make it work" for a single node and single asset chain

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the "better" solution is to teach our test infra how to really manage this stuff, but in the mean-time, we need a slightly-less-bad solution

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL try using the same ac_name, but diff rpc ports

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there may be some bugs, but that use should "work", in an ideal world. The internals may need to learn some stuff

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there is no way that our tests know how to calculate the correct RPC port for a random AC, but if we use REGTEST, it's known

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I'll try, maybe have to catch ports on fly via getinfo ü§î

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you can't call getinfo if you don't know the correct rpc port üòÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: everything breaks

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you need 2 nodes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: each need their own set of p2p/rpc ports

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: one can use the defaults, the other needs them specified, somehow

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is the core of the problem

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Yup, I see

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is a way to calculate the rpc port
